text: Sample at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017, red session. Aroma has dark malt, quite roasty with some cacao notes. Taste is on the sweet side with bourbon, butterscotch, toffee and spiced brownies.
[5/13/17] Draught at Mikkeller Beer Celebration Copenhagen 2017. Red session. Black, tan head. Dark chocolate, vanilla, nuts, coffee, sweet, full-bodied.
Mbcc red. Blackish. Strong cocoa, vanilla smooth roasty nose. Med full bodied, smooth, lean, sweetish flavour. Intense, clean, nice.

Intense caramel and chocolate, sweet bourbon, dark roast, sweet coffee. Hazy, very dark brown, small, creamy, beige head. Medium sweet. More rich chocolate, dark and creamy, caramel, toffee, moist pralines, soft carbonation, full bodied. Outstanding ASA/Impy, rich and powerful yet well-balanced. Keg at MBCC Red Session, Copenhagen.

Tap, mbcc, red session. 
Near black color, thin white head. 
Sweet vanilla, chocolate, malts, cocoa in aroma. 
Flavor has vanilla, chocolate, cocoa, sweetness. Some slight chili burn in finish i think?

Draught @ MBCC 2017. Pours pitch black with a smooth white head. Aroma of nuts, cocoa, vanilla, chocolate, roasty malts, almonds and oak. Taste is super smooth, slightly roasty and sweetish with some cocoa, vanilla, hazelnuts, coffee and hints of syrup. Finish is smooth, slightly roasty and sweetish with some coffee, cocoa and vanilla. Good one.
Tap at MBCC2017, Copenhagen. Color is almost black with slightly brownish head. Aromas and flavors: Cocoa, chocolate, coffee, vanilla, dryness and roasted malts. Excellent.

Pours black with low tan head. Aroma of chocolate, almonds, vanilla, mild coffee. Taste is sweet, chocolate and light bourbon, sweet lingering sugary finish. Rich and creamy body with soft carbonation.

Chucks 85th, Seattle. Barrel Roller 2017. Thick, lingering foam on very dark brown body. Interesting nose, almond liquor and smores. Definite marshmallow note on nose along with cookie. Lovely. Thick but not syrupy sip, filled with flavor. A whiff of alcohol but not too much burn. Chocolate base is great with smooth vanilla and almond flavors. Great balance and concept with these adjuncts, and done with such delicacy. Barrel and adjuncts dont get in the way of a delicious beer experience. Alcohol and base snappiness keep it clean. Very nice.

0,05l from tap at MBCC yellow session shared with / by the crew. black color, small tan head. smells of vanilla, spices, peppery, some cocoa, light cinnamon. very nice smell. full body, soft carbonation, slick mouthfeel. tastes lightly sweet, green herbal, cocoa, light molasses, spices, light cinnamon. finishes lightly sweet with notes of cinnamon, molasses and cocoa notes. very nice one, great balance quite smooth to drink.

8, 4, 8, 4, 17
Taster from beer junction. Nice vanilla and chocolate flavors. Sits on the edge of being complex and not. Great beer though.
22oz bottle pours out black topped with a tan head. Nose is sweet coconut sweetness roast malts chocolate. Taste is more of the coconut chocolate milk sweetness bourbon vanilla.
Bottle thanks to Rick. Dark black, lat pour. Aroma is utty, sweet,candy bar. Smooth and slick. Some maple flavors, pancakes. Nice with a bit of a sting.

Draft pour, 6 oz at Toronado, Seattle. God damn this stuff is good. Perfect welcome to Seattle beer here for Modern Times. Dark chocolate brown pour with a tan foam head that fades. Almond beers might as well be my favorite. Milk chocolate, cookie, sweet vanilla aroma. Smooth, cool, sweet milk chocolate flavor, soft bourbon notes, almond if you know its there. Vanilla. Chocolate and cream. So delicious. One of the better, more memorable beers Ive had in a while. So glad these guys are here.  Absolute standout of a beer.
Pours black with a low off white head. Aromas of milk chocolate, roasted malt, vanilla, lactose, roasted nuts. Taste is nutty with caramel notes. Mouthfeel is medium bodied with medium carbonation.

Pours dark with low tanned head 
Aromas of bourbon, nougats, vanilla, brown sugar, 
Taste has notes of bourbon, vanilla, nougats, chocolate, brown sugar
Bottle thanks to Matt. Pours dark brown with no head. Maraschino cherry/almond, hazelnut. Thick mouthfeel, low carbonation.

22oz bomber, big thanks to nbutler11, pours with a mahogany colored body that supports a thin tan head. The aroma offers up an inviting chocolate note, milk chocolate bar, a malt roastiness, a soft vanilla note and then soft thin bourbon. The taste delivers a blend of chocolate bar and milk chocolate Ovaltine flowing into dark roasted malts and then a smooth sweet integrated blend of vanilla and soft bourbon. Very nice. Solid sipper.

Aroma: dark malts, vanillin, vanilla, cocoa & intense bourbon.
Flavor is similar with erich dark malts notes, which tales on chocolate, some coffee, supported with notes of vanilla, cocoa, vanillin, sherry-like bourbon. Finish is dry, slightly sticky, body full, texture velvetly, carbonation is low. Imperial stout-ish.
On tap at the brewery. Pours black with small beige head that lasts. The aroma is strong nuts, roast, bourbon, wood. Thick body, roast, vanilla, nuts, wood, bourbon, very nice.

Draft @ Beav Tavern - Belching Beaver Brewery, Vista, CA. Pours a black color with a small tan head. Has a slightly roasted malty woody chocolate vanilla aroma with hints of almond. Slightly roasted malty woody vanilla nutty flavor. Has a slightly roasted malty woody bourbon vanilla finish with hints of almonds.

Rated with 3 other variants. Appearance all the same. Intense vanilla and almond accents to the aroma with some roast and alcohol. The flavor is pretty intense on the vanilla, less on the almond. Big and boozy, more so than the others. Heavy and a bit sticky with light carbonation. Interesting, but not my favorite of the group.

Looks like an imperial Porter/stout. Smell and flavor is of the barrel. Boozy decadent chocolate, vanilla bourbon. The coffee and cocoa come out as it warms a little, the almond only coming out as it warms a lot. A decadent sipper at the beginning and a complex sipper at the end.

Draught at Belching Beaver Tavern & Grill. Opaque black beer with a nice beige head. Chocolate aroma, almonds, raisins, figs, some vanilla, dark chocolate notes. Chocolate flavor, licorice, vanilla, bourbon notes, caramel, raisins, warming alcohol, almond notes. Great complex beer.
(En nitro à la source - vanilla and almond): Cest un lait damandes frappé et achevé au bourbon avec un fil conducteur vanillé épouvantablement efficace. Tristement pintable.
22oz bomber. Light barrel. Oak, vanilla, caramel and toffee. Medium body. Smooth and creamy. Very easy to drink for the ABV.
